Posts.Content: cla777 wrote: I HAD A MAMMO AND ULTRASOUND ON 01/09/12AND THESE WERE THE FINDINGS. IN THE MAMMO IN BOTH CC AND MLO PROJECTIONS THEY COMFRIM THE PRESENCE OF A CLUSTER OF PLEOMORPHIC CALCIFICATIONS IN THE UPPER OUTER RIGHT BREAST, AT A MIDDLE DEPTH. IN THE ULTRASOUND AT THE 9-10 OCLOCK POSITION OF THE RIGHT BREAST,6CM FROM THE NIPPLE,THERE IS A HYPOECHOIC SOLID, IRREGULAR MASS WHICH MEASURES 5X10X9MM. THE MASS DEMONSTRATES POSTERIOR ACOUSTIC SHADOWING. TINY ECHOGENIC REFLECTORS WITHIN IT CORRESPOND TO THE CALCIFICATIONS NOTED MAMMOGRAPHICALLY,BI-RAD4 SUSPICIOUS FINDINGS. BIOPSY IS 01/31/12 WHAT DOES ALL THIS MEAN ?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mammo and ultrasound cla777 33NY33

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2012 04:33PM cla777 wrote: Well tommorrow is the day of my biopsy. Hope it goes by fast! Does anyone know if the breast surgeon will be able to let me know anything? You would think that if they do hundreds of these they should be able to tell by they tissue they take.
Posts.Title: mammo and ultrasound cla777 33NY33

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 12:52PM cla777 wrote: Well had my biopsy yesterday and they performed a sterotactic biopsy. Was'nt expecting that but it went well. The dr. only biopsied the cluster of pleomorphic calcifications. He said he was more concerned with them than the hypoechoic solid, irregular mass that was found in the ultrsound. He said he wanted to make sure that this was not cancer first. He said that he could do a biopsy on the mass later. I dont know why he could'nt do them both at once?
Posts.Title: mammo and ultrasound cla777 33NY33

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2012 08:44PM cla777 wrote: Thank God! The results are negative!
